title: Added some suggestions from Ian Swett.
body:
Mention the HTTPS bootstrapping in the intro.
Remind the importance of using the origin name for validating
the TLS server cert.

title: Add a TO BE REMOVED section as suggested by Ben
Add a note that fallback A/AAAA records are needed for Alias form
Remove Alt-Svc sni= parameter
body: Finish removing the Alt-Svc "sni=" parameter (other than from the comparisons appendix discussion).

title: Adjust scheme and port description for clarity.
Improve formatting and cross-references
body: This should address Mike's formatting comments from the main review.

title: Ban fallback when ESNI is enabled
Change performance-optimized client behavior
body:
This gives clients an opt-out in the rare cases where
HTTPSSVC would impair performance, and also gives
server admins a clear way to avoid these cases.

title: Defend HSTS behavior against certain attackers
body:
With this change, the behavior might even be worthy of
the name "strict".

title: Change handling of nonstandard HTTP ports
body: EDIT: New approach: This handles nonstandard HTTP ports in the same way as HSTS.

title: Make the "hts" parameter implicit
body:
This makes HTTPSSVC more valuable as a security measure, for
websites that can't easily get themselves on the HSTS preload
list.

The value of the "_http" scheme prefix is unclear in this
formulation.  It could possibly be removed, depending on
the importance of supporting strange situations like
"https://example.com:80", or http and https on the same port.

title: Explain how this might solve the ANAME problem
Add Erik Nygren's HTTPSSVC version of the draft
body: This is Erik's original draft from my inbox, except for RFC-markdown syntax and linter fixes.
